It gives over 110 random verses and creeds on your wrist and you can click to refresh them if you want to go thru God's word in places you can't take out your phone. data.author: Pete Stoppani

changelog.release_notes: Fixed timeline bug

Added - Time Line support
Fixed - Occasional crashes due to memory leaks

Added support for Pebble Round
Added content indicators for all color models
Added color support.
Fixed paused timers running in the background.
Added a few more icons.

Added multiple stopwatch (counting up timer).
Added ability to select vibration type and repeat count.
More icons thanks to Nicola Schäppi
Fixed: App closed after deleting a timer from a "long press"

Put back long press of up button to delete a timer.
Don't flash the running icon.

Added icons.
Added long press on main screen to start/stop timers

Added:
- Resume active timers when app is reopened
- Timers run in the background and wake up app 5 seconds before a timer finishes
Fixed issue when creating a new timer.

data.description:
Multiple countdown timers for cooking, reminders, more!  

Multiple count-up timers (stopwatches) for timing activities and projects.

Timers can be as short as a few seconds to multiple days.  Timers run in the background and wake up the app 5 seconds before they finish.

A variety of icons and vibrations are available to customize timers.

A long press of the center button starts/stops timers from the main screen.

A long press of the up button on the timer screen to delete the timer.

UX design & icons, Nicola Schäppi, Werbeschluessel.ch

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed timeline bug

data.title: Multi-Timer+

data.author: Bryan

changelog.release_notes: Updated to work with Pebble v2.6, Added a new icon to the app
This is the first build of the Timer Repeat application

data.description:
This app is a simple countdown timer that vibrates when the countdown is done. You can set it to repeatedly countdown. Great for working out, switching tasks, intervals, or just a reminder to take a break.
Up/Down to change the time. 
Hold Up/Down to change the step size of the timer.
Select to start/stop timer.
Hold Select to turn the Repeat ON/OFF.

latest_release.release_notes: Updated to work with Pebble v2.6, Added a new icon to the app

data.author: Runtastic
data.description:
The Runtastic PRO app is a perfect fit for users of all fitness levels. Become a part of a global fitness community, with millions of users, that is fun and encouraging to improve your overall health, build cardio endurance or even train for a marathon! Start taking your health seriously with Runtastic by your side.

Deutsch

Die Runtastic PRO App eignet sich perfekt für alle Fitnessaktivitäten. Werde Teil der internationalen Fitness-Community mit Millionen von registrierten Nutzern. Egal ob du deine Gesundheit verbessern, deine Ausdauer erhöhen oder deine Fitnessziele erreichen möchtest, Runtastic unterstützt dich mit Spaß und Motivation.

Français 

Runtastic PRO est très bien adaptée à tous les niveaux de fitness. Faites partie d'une communauté mondiale de remise en forme au service de millions d'utilisateurs, et cela de façon amusante et inspirante - que ce soit dans le but d'améliorer votre état général de santé, de renforcer votre endurance cardio-respiratoire ou de vous entraîner pour un marathon ! 

Español 

La app Runtastic PRO es ideal para todos los que quieran ponerse o mantenerse en forma, sin importar su nivel de fitness. Forma parte de una comunidad divertida y motivadora, con millones de usuarios, ¡ya sea que desees mejorar tu salud, aumentar tu resistencia o correr una maratón!
data.title: Runtastic PRO

Allows you to control two GPIO pins on a Raspberry Pi to arm and disarm your home alarm.

For more details and instructions, please visit the app website linked below.

data.description:
Allows tracking each player's life in M:TG. In the center, there is a timer that will count up once started.

Buttons:
Up - remove 1 from top counter
Up long - add 1 to top counter, continue until released
Down - remove 1 from bottom counter
Down long - add 1 to bottom counter, continue until released

Vibrations:
45 min - 1 long
46-49 min - one short each
50 min - 3 short

data.author: Stopka

changelog.release_notes: Now you can set timers.
French, German and Spanish localization

Redesigned action bar icons and app icon;
Added status bar icon

data.description:
Supports - English, French, German and Spanish.

A handy time measuring tool. You can create up to 10 independent timers and/or stopwatches. There are in fact no limits for maximum measured time. Stopwatches offer precision of hundredths of a second, support split time, and have a 30 lap history. Timers notifies you using vibrations. The app is optimized for battery saving by refreshing time display only once per second. Everything is of course persistent: the time continues counting even when the app is turned off and timers wake up the app to show notification.

Do you like this app? Rate it with a ♥. Have you found a bug? Do you have another feedback? Send me a email.

latest_release.release_notes: Now you can set timers.

data.title: StopWatch

data.author: Belphemur

changelog.release_notes: Correct launching error on Pebble Time (Basalt)
Ready for Pebble Time
Balancing in the number of cards and limit of stamina.

Stamina

This is clearly the biggest change, MiniDungeon is a, mostly, idle game. You just wait for the watch to tell you to do interact with it. Now with stamina, you are able to move through the dungeon yourself. You are given at the begin of the game 10 of stamina, each time you use one, you advance in the dungeon. The stamina recovers  X every minutes, where X is your level.  The limit of stamina you can gather is directly linked to your level. 

Score Calculator

At the end of the game, a score is not calculated and given to the player. It's possible that later on I implement a leaderboard online using Pebble.JS. I prefer to keep for now secret the formula used to calculate the score (even if it's public in the source code).

Easy Mode

When activated, the player can choose to climb or not to the next floor, the limit for increasing stats is disable (usually you can't increase your stat more than your level) and when you die you can choose to continue playing from where you where. Keep just in mind your death are counted and will be removed from your final score.
Minor bug fixes in Persistence

Persist the Deck of Adventure Card
Some optimisation

Updated old images.
Some bug fix with an image never showing.
Balancing fix and Correcting the price in the Sell screen of the Shop.

Using Persistence to save the game when you close the application.
Some fixes and correction of Memory Leak.
Balancing the different "Adventure" (Shop, Battle, Floor and Item)
Memory improvement

data.description:
MiniDungeon Extended is a small adventure game on your watch. The goal is to survive to the 20th floor of the dungeon and defeat the final monster there. In order to aid you with this task, you have a sword to deal physical damage to monsters. You will also find in the dungeon potions to heal yourself as well as offensive items to help take down the more powerful monsters.

The Game now save it's state when you close it and will return where you where when you reopen it.

The easy mode is an addon of the extended version of the game. When activated, the player can choose to climb or not to the next floor, the limit for increasing stats is disable (usually you can't increase your stat more than your level) and when you die you can choose to continue playing from where you where. Keep just in mind your death are counted and will be removed from your final score.

latest_release.release_notes: Correct launching error on Pebble Time (Basalt)

data.title: MiniDungeon EX

data.author: Dirk Mika

changelog.release_notes:
New levels (now 60!) added.
You can now choose from three level of difficulty.
1. Easy: the same level as before
2. Normal: slightly faster ball, you need 300 points for an extra live (instead of 250), no Solid2Normal Blocks powerup.
3. Hard: even faster ball, you need 400 points for an extra live, no Solid2Normal Blocks powerup.

Demo Mode added. Wait 7 seconds after launching the app to see a short demo.

Power-Ups are animated when they fall. (Pebble Time and Pebble Time Round only)

App-Icon and settings icons fixed on classic Pebble.

Added compatibility for Pebble Time Round
Added highscore
Added ability to reset a game.
Increased number of balls and power-ups simultaneously visible.

- Pebble Time ready
- New PowerUps added
    - 1UP (adds a live)
    - Shield (ball bounces at floor)
    - Solid2Normal (turns solid blocks into normal, breakable blocks)
- A PowerUp is dropped if no block has been hit for more than 15 seconds
- Speed (Ball) and duration of PowerUps slightly tuned.
- New block type. Drops a PowerUp on hit.
- Animations slightly modified.
- Displays number of lives left (top right corner)
- Display FPS (if enabled in settings) instead of number of lives.
- App renamed due to trademark issues. (Pebble 'kindly' asked my to do so)

- Compatible with Pebble Firmware v2.0
- Now settings are saved.
- Game ist paused on receiving a notification
- Game is saved when you quit the app.
- New Option to keep backlight on while game is running
- New Option to turn on "sound" (vibrations)

data.description:
This is an arkanoid-clone for your pebble.

Control:
'up' - move left
'select' - start / pause game, (enter settings on long press)
'down' - move right

There are eight different kind of 'power-ups':
1. extra ball 
2. slow ball
3. fast ball
4. 'power'-ball (destroys blocks without being reflected)
5. missile launcher (automatically launches missiles from your paddle)
6. shield (ball bounces at floor)
7. Solid2Normal (turns solid block into normal, destroyable blocks)
8. 1UP (adds an extra live)

latest_release.release_notes:
New levels (now 60!) added.
You can now choose from three level of difficulty.
1. Easy: the same level as before
2. Normal: slightly faster ball, you need 300 points for an extra live (instead of 250), no Solid2Normal Blocks powerup.
3. Hard: even faster ball, you need 400 points for an extra live, no Solid2Normal Blocks powerup.

data.title: Blocks

data.author: Fedor Iskhakov
data.description: Keep your presentation talk within time limits with this simple fully on-pebble visual time keeper that will notify half time, 5 and 1 min remaining with a vibration pulse. A list of common intervals for the talk from 3 min to 180 min are available. Large dial provides visual clue on the time passed and remaining.
data.title: Presenter Timer

Thanks to my buddy Jon Dayton from the blog, Smart2Noise Ratio, for the idea! http://smart2noise.blogspot.com

data.author: Triggertrap

changelog.release_notes: Welcome to the first Triggertrap for Pebble! Press a button, take a photo. Simple as that! Currently you'll need the beta version of Triggertrap Mobile for Android. iOS support is coming very soon.

ios.name: Triggertrap: Camera remote for your SLR

data.description:
Triggertrap for Pebble brings awesome smartwatch-based triggering to your DSLR or advanced compact camera. Paired with the Triggertrap app for iOS, you just need a Triggertrap Mobile kit to connect your phone or tablet to your camera and you're all set to get creative.

iOS users can use the Pebble mode to trigger your camera remotely for perfectly sharp still life photos, or to make sure you’re in the group photo! You can also start and stop your timelapse sequences, or expertly control your long exposures with Press and Lock and Timed Release modes.

Just pair your Pebble with your iOS device, then press the big red button in the Wearables mode to get started – it will even open the Triggertrap app on your Pebble for you!

To connect your phone or tablet to your camera, buy a Triggertrap Mobile Dongle separately, and check out the Triggertrap website for a list of supported cameras and for more information. Currently more than 350 camera models are supported, with support added for new cameras all the time!

latest_release.release_notes: Welcome to the first Triggertrap for Pebble! Press a button, take a photo. Simple as that! Currently you'll need the beta version of Triggertrap Mobile for Android. iOS support is coming very soon.

data.title: Triggertrap

changelog.release_notes:
New Look
Supports all current Pebble platforms
Many new features
Includes payment services via KiezelPay (kiezelpay.com)

Changed to a new API for Cricket Scores to alleviate problems being experienced.

data.description:
***NEW VERSION!***

Live Cricket V2 is a major re-write of the entire user interface of Live Cricket to work on all current Pebble Platforms.

Live Cricket is no longer free, a one time purchase using KiezelPay at a low $0.99 is required to continue using Live Cricket after the 3 day free trial has elapsed. This has become necessary to support development and server costs.

New Features include:
Brand New UI
Support for Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel and Pebble Time Round
Bluetooth disconnection notification, click vibrations, improved readability and so so much more!

--------------------------

Live Cricket is a live Cricket Match / Score tracking application. Use this Pebble WatchApp to find the cricket match you are interested in and then monitor the scores in near-realtime.

Features include:
Match Overview and Details (overs, bowler, batsman) etc.
New Multi Screen Layout to improve readibility
Matches including all international 1-day, 5-days and T20 and many local matches
10 score history
"Haptic" vibrations on button clicks
Short vibration to alert you to each time the score changes

latest_release.release_notes:
New Look
Supports all current Pebble platforms
Many new features
Includes payment services via KiezelPay (kiezelpay.com)

changelog.release_notes:
The disassembly view is prettier now.
Pressing Select on the disassembly view will now toggle showing instruction bytes.
Added disassembler feature.

First appstore release
+2.0

data.description:
Hexeditor and Disassembler for your watch.

This is a DANGEROUS tool, not a toy. Be careful with it. Misuse could brick your Pebble.
Some areas of memory are not allowed to be read. If you try, the app will crash. Trying to read protected memory should not harm your Pebble, but still be careful.

On the edit screen, up and down modify the selected nibble and select moves to the next.  Long press select to save.

On the dissassembly view, pressing Down will scroll by the instruction size at the top of the screen, where as pressing Up will always scroll up by the minimum instruction size(2). Pressing Select will toggle showing instruction bytes.

latest_release.release_notes:
The disassembly view is prettier now.
Pressing Select on the disassembly view will now toggle showing instruction bytes.

data.title: System Info

data.author: Partlyhuman

changelog.release_notes:
Version 2.7:
Lots of new settings!
- Optionally starts a new work session right away, if you don't like the manual method. 
- Customize the frequency of ticking while working: Anywhere from once a second to once every other minute.
- Customize frequency of long breaks, not just once every 4 sessions.
Bug fixes!

Version 2.5
- Fixed a bug where long breaks (recesses) didn't occur
- Preparing app for new options!

Version 2.4: 
- Recompiled under latest SDK 2.8 to fix rendering bugs
- Removed Russian language which required custom firmware

* 2.3 - Added setting to show system clock.
* 2.2 - Added French translation.
* 2.1 - Updated to use Pebble SDK Beta 2. Added Russian translation.
* 2.0 - Updated to use Pebble SDK version 2.0. httpebble no longer required, settings are stored on phone. A branch will be created for legacy-sdk-1.0.
* 1.0 - Initial release.

The "Pomodoro Technique®" and "Pomodoro®" are registered trademarks of Francesco Cirillo. We have no relationship with, nor do we endorse, these marks, their owner, or the company FC Garage.

SMS directly from the pebble. 
Configure email->text addr + canned msgs and then, send texts to your friends.

Example of config page ... 
From: 4165551212
Who0: Lucy
Num0: 9055551212@sms.carrier.com
Msg0: Hi   

Note: #@sms.carrier.com must be a valid email->text addr; use your email acct to verify the addr. Keep msgs short (24 chars).

changelog.release_notes:
v1.0.0

Based on the New York Times magazine column, this app takes you through 12 high intensity exercises, lasting 30 seconds each, and 10 seconds rest in between, completing in about 7 minutes.

The exercise name and the count of seconds are shown, and you may pause and resume as you please. Vibrating pulse alerts you to the start and end of an exercise.

Removed the texts promoting my PebbleQuest game.
Adjusted narration texts and improved the handling of strings in general.

Updated the intro narration to include information about "Controls," modified the "About" narration, and updated narration transitions so that any button may be used to advance to the next screen.
Adjusted the wording/formatting of some narration texts.
Improved overall performance and made a few minor text adjustments.

data.description:
A 3D first-person maze-navigation game and the foundation for SpaceMerc and PebbleQuest. Search each maze for its exit, marked by a hole in the ground, to earn points and unlock up to 12 achievements!

UP: Press/hold to step forward. Press twice to turn left.
SELECT: Open in-game menu; make selections.
DOWN: Press/hold to step back. Press twice to turn right.

latest_release.release_notes: Updated for SDK 3.8 compatibility.

data.author: Gizmodad
data.description:
An app to help when training intervals.  Use the up button to set your walk (or rest) interval in seconds, the down button sets your run (or work)  interval.  
Select button starts.  A short vibrate means start running, long vibrate means start walking.
data.title: Intervals

data.author: iDorfl

changelog.release_notes: The first version of run302010 Pebble application.  Runners greatly benefit from a controlled fartlek workout referred as 30-20-10. run302010 is an excellent tool for the 30-20-10 workout and a great companion for any run tracking application used on a smartphone. Start run302010 on Pebble during your run. It counts the seconds for you, signals end of each interval by a short vibration, and displays actual time, so Pebble still serves as a watch.  The application is extremely easy to use.  Select button starts and pauses the workout.  Double-click on select button resets the workout.  End of each interval is signaled by a short vibration. This can be combined by a short visual check in order to remember what interval is in progress.  Up (+) and down (-) buttons are used to set number of laps - how many times the 30-20-10 workout should be repeated.

data.description: Runners greatly benefit from controlled fartlek workout referred as 30-20-10. run302010 is an excellent tool for the 30-20-10 workout and a great companion for any run tracking application used on a smartphone. data.author: jaimeyu

changelog.release_notes:
Fix bootup bug.
Fix GPS tracking.

This version has a bug fix that solved the lagginess when requesting for stop data. This was because the js timeout was triggered almost immediately which blocked the correct http request from getting to the pebble watch.
I added a better number selector because it can take 5 minutes to go from 0 to 3000. Turns out I had people going all the way to 7000... I can only imagine how much that sucked. The new version fixes that with a better number selector. I moved the number selector into its own module so it should be relatively easy to use in other projects.
Added some default bus / stop numbers to make scrolling easier. Future version will have a better stop selector.

Redesigned for > 2.6 Pebble releases. Since 2.6, the app has been crashing at boot up. New visual layout. New button mapping. See description. Near complete rewrite. Improved REST API so requests should be < 300 ms for much improved responsiveness. Old releases relied on downloading the entire JSON package. This release uses a new logic path that does most of the work on the server side. Removed the clock bar for visual real estate reasons. May come back in future releases (please let me know if you need it). Ground work laid to store favorites stops.

data.description:
This app will keep you to up to date on your next upcoming OC Transpo bus. It periodically updates itself so it will always have the latest information for you. 

Button layout:
UP -> Select bus route
DOWN -> Select stop number
SELECT -> Long press -> Switch direction
SELECT -> Short press -> Manual refresh

In the number selector:
SELECT -> Move to the next digit
UP -> Increment number
DOWN -> Decrement number

latest_release.release_notes:
Fix bootup bug.
Fix GPS tracking.

Minor update to fix motion controls.

First release supporting Pebble 2.0! New features:
* Control the game by flicking your wrist! Pause the game via the SELECT button and turn on MOTION CONTROL to enable this feature.
* Better ball physics - thank Newton for inertia!
* Set your leaderboard username via the Falldown Pebble app preferences page on your phone! Trash talking your buddy's pathetic score has never been easier!

data.description: Falldown is a game about steering a falling ball around walls of bricks. You steer with the UP and DOWN buttons or, optionally, by flicking your wrist. Your objective is not to let the ball hit the top of the screen. Like all classic video games, you will eventually lose as the increasing speed of falling takes its toll. Try to get the highest score you can before it's all over!

changelog.release_notes:
Added feature to change text/background color form iOS App.
Added feature to display and change words within specified seconds.
Added feature to display by letters.

Supported Pebble SDK 3.x
Supported Pebble Time Round

- Supported Pebble Time (Color screen)
- Supported displaying meaning of a word

- Added feature to display meaning of a word. (Push select button to display)

To use this version, please update companion app also.

Fixed memory leaks
Added Workweek

EverLearn is an iOS application to learn words using Evernote! 
This Watchapp can display words come from iOS devices. 
- Added status info

data.description:
- Supported Color Screen
- New words displayed in red.
- Meaning of a word can be displayed

latest_release.release_notes:
Added feature to change text/background color form iOS App.
Added feature to display and change words within specified seconds.
Added feature to display by letters.

data.title: EverLearn

data.author: Katharine Berry

changelog.release_notes:
First SDK-2 release. 

- Feature: stopwatch keeps counting when leaving the app and returning
- Feature: laps persist when leaving the app and returning
- Bug fix: the decisecond included in logged laps after running for more than an hour is now accurate

data.description: Stopwatch with thirty lap history.

latest_release.release_notes:
First SDK-2 release. 

- Feature: stopwatch keeps counting when leaving the app and returning
- Feature: laps persist when leaving the app and returning
- Bug fix: the decisecond included in logged laps after running for more than an hour is now accurate

data.title: Stopwatch

data.author: Code Sector
data.description: Maverick is a GPS off-road navigation app for Android devices. It automatically caches all your maps for offline use so that you can access them even without an Internet connection. This app is great for hiking, boating, geocaching, and other outdoor activities.
data.title: Maverick

data.author: GNaturani
